EL.content: [re: “we” of apocalyptic speech] responsibility is ineluctable, finds sign of its freedom in this fatality > not Kantian practical universality, formalizable obligation: does not replace itself, delegate itself
EL.linkedContent: [re: “we” of apocalyptic speech] responsibility is ineluctable, finds sign of its freedom in this fatality > not Kantian practical universality, formalizable obligation: does not replace itself, delegate itself

HST.content: for Levinas, when I mourn, I feel responsible, I murder: “my own,” those I believe I killed, I love > ineluctable empire of phantasm at origin of meaning [Blanchot also links thought of death to murder]
HST.linkedContent: for Levinas, when I mourn, I feel responsible, I murder: “my own,” those I believe I killed, I love > ineluctable empire of phantasm at origin of meaning [Blanchot also links thought of death to murder]
